00054   multiCalibrator::multiCalibrator() :  marlin::Processor("multiCalibrator"),_connectionAvailable(false)  {
00055 
00056     _description = " This processor adds the multi amplitude as " PAR_MULTI " to the event and calibrates the thresholds."
00057 #ifdef MULTI_DBINIT
00058       " The threshold results are written to the conditions database. ";
00059 #else
00060     ;
00061 #endif
00062 
00063     registerInputCollection( LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT, "ADCCollectionName" ,
00064                              "The name of the adc collection (input) to be used" ,
00065                              _adcColName ,
00066                              std::string(COL_ADC) );
00067 
00068     registerInputCollection( LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT, "connectionCollectionName" ,
00069                              "The name of the DAQconnection collection (input) to be used" ,
00070                              _connectionColName ,
00071                              std::string("multiConnection") );
00072 
00073     registerInputCollection( LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT, "referenceThresholds" ,
00074                              "The name of the reference threshold collection to be used to calculate rejected fraction" ,
00075                              _referenceThresholdColName ,
00076                              std::string("") );
00077 
00078     registerProcessorParameter("TriggerEventName",
00079                                "Name of the event parameter name which contains the current trigger main word .",
00080                                _parNameTriggerEvent,
00081                                std::string(PAR_TRIGGER_EVENT));
00082 #ifdef MULTI_DBINIT
00083 
00084     registerProcessorParameter("thresholdFolder",
00085                                "folder in the database to which the threshold results should be written",
00086                                _thresholdFolderName,
00087                                std::string(""));
00088 
00089     registerProcessorParameter("rejectedFractionFolder",
00090                                "folder in the database to which the fraction of rejected events for each threshold should be written",
00091                                _rejectedFractionFolderName,
00092                                std::string(""));
00093 
00094     registerProcessorParameter("rejectedFractionReferenceFolder",
00095                                "folder in the database to which the fraction of rejected events for the reference thresholds should be written",
00096                                _rejectedFractionReferenceFolderName,
00097                                std::string(""));
00098 #endif
00099     registerProcessorParameter("OutputFilePath",
00100                                "path for the root file inlcuding the multi histograms",
00101                                _outputFilePath,
00102                                std::string("./"));
00103 
00104 
00105     _signalBinning.clear();
00106     _signalBinning.push_back(20000);
00107     _signalBinning.push_back(0);
00108     _signalBinning.push_back(20000);
00109 
00110     registerProcessorParameter( "SignalBinning" ,
00111                                 "The binning for the multi counter amplitude  histograms." ,
00112                                 _signalBinning ,
00113                                 _signalBinning ,
00114                                 _signalBinning.size() ) ;
00115 
00116     _purityList.clear();
00117     _purityList.push_back(99.9);
00118     _purityList.push_back(99.);
00119     _purityList.push_back(95.);
00120     _purityList.push_back(90.);
00121 
00122     registerProcessorParameter( "purities" ,
00123                                 "List of purities for which the thresholds should be calculated. 99.9 means that at least 99.9% of the two mip events are rejected." ,
00124                                 _purityList,
00125                                 _purityList ,
00126                                 _purityList.size() ) ;
00127 
00128 
00129     registerProcessorParameter( "gausRange",
00130                                 "processing range of the gaus in the convolution (+- ADC counts)",
00131                                 _gausRange,
00132                                 (float)300);
00133 
00134     registerProcessorParameter( "rebin",
00135                                 "rebin factor for the histogram before the fit gets applied\nthis heavily affects the CPU time needed for the fit\nshould be a power of 2 to reduce DNL of the CALICE CRC ADC",
00136                                 _rebin,
00137                                 (int)16);
00138 
00139     registerProcessorParameter( "granFac",
00140                                 "factor for the granularity of the 1 & 2 MIP histograms generated from the fit results; reasonably the same as rebin",
00141                                 _granFac,
00142                                 (int)16);
00143 
00144     registerOptionalParameter( "skipCalibration",
00145                                "If this is \"true\", only the parameter is added to the event.",
00146                                _skipCalibration,
00147                                std::string("false"));
00148   }
00149 
00150   void multiCalibrator::conditionsChanged(lcio::LCCollection* col) {
00151     std::string condName = col->getParameters().getStringVal("CollectionName");
00152     streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "update for conditions collection " << condName << std::endl;
00153 
00154     if (condName == _connectionColName) {
00155       if (col->getNumberOfElements() != 1) {
00156         streamlog_out(WARNING1) << "unnatural connection collection size: " << col->getNumberOfElements() << std::endl;
00157       }
00158       for (unsigned int elm_i=0;elm_i< (unsigned int)col->getNumberOfElements() ; elm_i++) {
00159         DAQconnection connection(col->getElementAt(elm_i));
00160         _crate   = connection.getCrate();
00161         _slot    = connection.getSlot();
00162         _fe      = connection.getFe();
00163         _chip    = connection.getChip();
00164         _channel = connection.getChannel();
00165         _connectionAvailable = true;
00166         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "found multi connection info: " << _crate << "," << _slot << "," << _fe << "," << _chip << "," << _channel << std::endl;
00167       }
00168     }
00169     else if (condName == _referenceThresholdColName) {
00170       for (unsigned int elm_i=0;elm_i< (unsigned int)col->getNumberOfElements() ; elm_i++) {
00171         VetoThreshold threshold(col->getElementAt(elm_i));
00172         _referenceThresholds[threshold.getPurity()] = threshold.getThreshold();
00173       }
00174     }
00175   }
00176 
00177   void multiCalibrator::init() {
00178 
00179     printParameters();
00180 
00181     _runNumber = std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::infinity();
00182     _startTime = 0;
00183     _endTime = 0;
00184 
00185     marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener( this,_connectionColName);
00186     marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener( this,_referenceThresholdColName);
00187     if (_skipCalibration != "true") {
00188       _sigHist = new TH1F("MultiSignal","Multi counter signal", (int)_signalBinning[0], (double)_signalBinning[1],(double)_signalBinning[2]);
00189       _pedHist = new TH1F("MultiPedestal","Multi counter pedestal", (int)_signalBinning[0], (double)_signalBinning[1],(double)_signalBinning[2]);
00190     }
00191 
00192   }
00193 
00194   void multiCalibrator::processRunHeader( LCRunHeader* run) {
00195     if (_runNumber != std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::infinity()) {
00196       streamlog_out(ERROR) << "Cannot process more than one run!!!!! " << std::endl;
00197       throw marlin::StopProcessingException(&amultiCalibrator);
00198     }
00199 
00200     _runNumber = run->getRunNumber();
00201   }
00202 
00203   void multiCalibrator::fillHist( TH1F* hist, LCEvent* evt) {
00204     try {
00205       LCCollection* col_adc = evt->getCollection( _adcColName ) ;
00206 
00207       for (unsigned int elm_i=0;elm_i<(unsigned int)(col_adc->getNumberOfElements()); elm_i++) {
00208         AdcBlock adc_block(col_adc->getElementAt(elm_i));
00209 
00210         if ((unsigned int)(adc_block.getCrateID()) == _crate
00211             && (unsigned int)(adc_block.getSlotID()) == _slot
00212             && (unsigned int)(adc_block.getBoardFrontEnd()) == _fe
00213             && (unsigned int)(adc_block.getMultiplexPosition()) == _channel) {
00214           if (_skipCalibration != "true")  hist->Fill(adc_block.getAdcVal(_chip));
00215           evt->parameters().setValue(PAR_MULTI,(float)(adc_block.getAdcVal(_chip)));
00216 
00217           // there is only one multi counter
00218           break;
00219         }
00220       }
00221     }
00222     catch (  DataNotAvailableException &err ) {
00223     }
00224 
00225   }
00226 
00227   void multiCalibrator::processEvent( LCEvent * evt ) {
00228     if (_startTime == 0) _startTime = evt->getTimeStamp()-1;
00229     _endTime = evt->getTimeStamp()+1;
00230 
00231     if (!_connectionAvailable) {
00232       streamlog_out(WARNING1) << "No MULTI connection information available, cannot process multi" << std::endl;
00233       return;
00234     }
00235 
00236     TriggerBits triggerEvent = evt->getParameters().getIntVal(_parNameTriggerEvent);
00237 
00238     bool pedestal = triggerEvent.isPedestalTrigger();
00239     bool beam = triggerEvent.isBeamTrigger();
00240 
00241     if (beam) {
00242       fillHist(_sigHist, evt);
00243     }
00244     else if (pedestal) {
00245       fillHist(_pedHist, evt);
00246     }
00247     else streamlog_out(WARNING1) << "Event which is neither beam nor pedestal" << std::endl;
00248   }
00249 
00250 
00251   void multiCalibrator::end()  {
00252 
00253     if (_skipCalibration == "true") {
00254       streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "calibration disabled -- nothing to do" << std::endl;
00255     }
00256     else {
00257       TH1* fitHist=0;
00258       TH1* pureMIPhist=0;
00259       TH1* oneMIPhist=0;
00260       TH1* twoMIPhist=0;
00261       TH1* fitResultHist=0;
00262       TH1* fitHistFine=0;
00263       TH1* subHist=0;
00264       TH1* subHistBiasRemoved=0;
00265 
00266       TF1* g=0;
00267       TF1* gg=0;
00268       TF1* l=0;
00269       TF1* ll=0;
00270       TF1* bias=0;
00271 
00272       TConvolution* convoluter=0;
00273 
00274 
00275       if (_pedHist && _sigHist) {
00276         const Int_t REBIN   = _rebin;   // to speed up the fit the histogram is rebinned
00277         const Int_t GRANFAC = _granFac; // for the estimation of threshold a better binning than for the fit is necessary
00278 
00279         std::time_t now = std::time(NULL);
00280         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "start of multi calibration " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00281 
00282         // get a working copy of the raw histogram
00283         fitHist = (TH1*) _sigHist->Clone("MultiCalibratorHistForFit");
00284 
00285         // rebin and remeber the dimensions of new histogram, this is necessary to properly add histograms later
00286         fitHist->Rebin(REBIN);
00287         const Int_t nBins = fitHist->GetNbinsX();
00288         const Double_t minRange = fitHist->GetBinLowEdge(1);
00289         const Double_t maxRange = fitHist->GetBinLowEdge(nBins) + fitHist->GetBinWidth(nBins);
00290         const Double_t binWidth =  fitHist->GetBinWidth(1);
00291         const Double_t entries =  fitHist->GetEntries();
00292 
00293         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "Rebinned histogram has " << nBins << " bins in range from " << minRange << " to " << maxRange << std::endl;
00294         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "BinWidth: " << binWidth << std::endl;
00295 
00296 
00297         // as the convoluted function has no start value apprixmation, we have to do it by hand
00298         now = std::time(NULL);
00299         streamlog_out(MESSAGE1) << "estimating start values for convoluted fit " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00300 
00301         g = new TF1("g","gaus",minRange,maxRange);
00302         l = new TF1("l","landau",minRange,maxRange);
00303 
00304         fitHist->Fit(l,"RQ0N");
00305         _pedHist->Fit(g,"RQ0N");
00306 
00307         Double_t pedestal = g->GetParameter(1);
00308 
00309         /* generate the functions for the convolution, we need the properly normalized versions
00310            also one function should have the mean/MPV fixed at the origin, for our case the gaussian */
00311         gg = new TF1("gg","TMath::Gaus(x,0,[0],1)",-1.*_gausRange,_gausRange);
00312         gg->SetParName(0,"sigma");
00313         ll = new TF1("ll","TMath::Landau(x,[0],[1],1)",minRange,maxRange);
00314         ll->SetParNames("MPV","sigma");
00315 
00316         /* initialize the functions for the convolution
00317            first approximation:
00318            gaus broadening is pure electronic noise (pedestal fit width)
00319            landau parameters are taken from landau fit of the signal */
00320         gg->SetParameter(0,g->GetParameter(2));  // Gaus sigma
00321         ll->SetParameter(0,l->GetParameter(1));  // Landau MPV
00322         ll->SetParameter(1,l->GetParameter(2));  // Landau sigma
00323 
00324         // get convoluted function
00325         convoluter = new TConvolution("convolution",gg,ll);
00326         TF1* conv = convoluter->GetConvolutedFunction();
00327 
00328         // normalize
00329         conv->SetParameter(3,binWidth*entries);
00330 
00331         // set fit range
00332         Double_t fitRangeMax = l->GetParameter(1)+6*l->GetParameter(2); // TO-DO, fit range should not be hardcoded
00333         Double_t fitRangeMin = l->GetParameter(1)-6*l->GetParameter(2);
00334         conv->SetRange(fitRangeMin,fitRangeMax);
00335 
00336         // fitting signal
00337         now = std::time(NULL);
00338         streamlog_out(MESSAGE1) << "fitting convoluted function " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00339         fitHist->Fit(conv,"Q0RN");
00340 
00341         Double_t MIPpos = conv->GetMaximumX();
00342         Double_t MIP = MIPpos - pedestal;
00343         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "pedestal position: " << pedestal << " MIP position: " << MIPpos << " MIP: " << MIP << std::endl;
00344 
00345 
00346         now = std::time(NULL);
00347         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "generating histogram from fit function " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00348 
00349         /* we need something faster than a function generated by convolution for the later processing
00350            therefore a histogram is generated from the function
00351            also the histogram is readable without the ROOT extension when saved in the file */
00352         conv->SetRange(MIPpos-0.5*MIP,maxRange);  // extend range
00353 
00354         fitResultHist = new TH1F("fitResultHist","one MIP histogram",nBins,minRange,maxRange);
00355         fitResultHist->Add(conv);
00356 
00357         /* How good is the fit? How much double events exist?
00358            generate residual */
00359         now = std::time(NULL);
00360         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "generating substracted histogram " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now)) ;
00361 
00362         subHist = (TH1*) fitHist->Clone("substractedHist");
00363         subHist->GetListOfFunctions()->Clear();
00364         subHist->Sumw2();
00365         subHist->Add(fitResultHist,-1);
00366 
00367 
00368         /* We need to know the distribution of the two MIP events, for the calculation of the treshold.
00369            To save CPU the distribution is simulated from the single MIP distribution. */
00370         now = std::time(NULL);
00371         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "generating distributions for threshold calculation" << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now)) ;
00372 
00373         /* Before playing with the parameters of the result: backup
00374            using vector, as some compiler options do not allow arrays to be initalized with a const generated within the function */
00375         const int NPAR = conv->GetNpar();
00376         std::vector<Double_t> parBackup;
00377         parBackup.reserve(NPAR);
00378         conv->GetParameters(&(parBackup[0]));
00379 
00380         // generate finer histogram of the fit result (for reference)
00381         fitHistFine = new TH1F("fitHistfine","one MIP histogram",nBins*GRANFAC,minRange,maxRange);
00382         conv->SetParameter(3,conv->GetParameter(3)/(float)GRANFAC); // renormalize to new binning
00383         fitHistFine->Add(conv);
00384         conv->SetParameters(&(parBackup[0]));
00385 
00386         /* We need the MIP distribution without pedestal & electronics noise broadening for the later calculation of the two MIP distribution */
00387         pureMIPhist = new TH1F("pureMIPhist","one MIP histogram without pedestal and electronic noise",nBins*GRANFAC,minRange,maxRange);
00388         conv->SetParameter(0,sqrt(pow(conv->GetParameter(0),2)-pow(g->GetParameter(2),2))); // quadratically substract the pedestal width (electronics noise)
00389         conv->SetParameter(1,conv->GetParameter(1)-pedestal); // shift for pedestal
00390         conv->SetRange(MIP-0.5*MIP,maxRange);
00391         pureMIPhist->Add(conv);
00392         conv->SetParameters(&(parBackup[0]));
00393 
00394         now = std::time(NULL);
00395         streamlog_out(MESSAGE2) << "generating MIP & two MIP histogram " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00396 
00397         oneMIPhist = new TH1F("oneMIPhist","one MIP histogram",nBins*GRANFAC,minRange,maxRange);
00398         for (unsigned i(0); i<1000000;i++) oneMIPhist->Fill(pureMIPhist->GetRandom() + g->GetRandom());
00399 
00400         twoMIPhist = new TH1F("twoMIPhist","two MIP histogram",nBins*GRANFAC,minRange,maxRange);
00401         for (unsigned i(0); i<1000000;i++) twoMIPhist->Fill(pureMIPhist->GetRandom() + pureMIPhist->GetRandom() + g->GetRandom());
00402 
00403         // now calculate threshold from distribution
00404 
00405         std::sort(_purityList.begin(), _purityList.end());  // order of values is important for an efficient threshold calculation;
00406 
00407         Int_t bin=0;
00408         Double_t rejectInt=0;
00409         LCCollection *thresholdCollection = new LCCollectionVec(LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT);
00410         LCCollection *lossCollection = new LCCollectionVec(LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT);
00411 
00412         LCCollection *referenceLossCollection = 0;
00413         if (_referenceThresholdColName!= "") referenceLossCollection = new LCCollectionVec(LCIO::LCGENERICOBJECT);
00414 
00415         for (int pos=(int)_purityList.size()-1; pos>=0 && bin<twoMIPhist->GetNbinsX();--pos) {
00416 
00417           float purity = _purityList[pos];
00418           float limit = (1. - purity/100.)*twoMIPhist->GetEntries();
00419           while ( rejectInt < limit && bin<twoMIPhist->GetNbinsX()) rejectInt += twoMIPhist->GetBinContent(bin++);
00420 
00421           float thresholdValue = twoMIPhist->GetBinLowEdge(bin-1);
00422           float thresholdValueErr = twoMIPhist->GetBinWidth(bin-1)/2.;
00423           float effectivePurity = (1. -(rejectInt - twoMIPhist->GetBinContent(bin-1))/twoMIPhist->GetEntries())*100.;
00424           VetoThreshold *threshold = new VetoThreshold(purity,effectivePurity,thresholdValue,thresholdValueErr);
00425           thresholdCollection->addElement(threshold);
00426 
00427           Int_t thresholdBinSignal = _sigHist->FindBin(thresholdValue);
00428           float lostEvents = _sigHist->Integral(thresholdBinSignal,_sigHist->GetNbinsX());
00429           float lossFraction = lostEvents/_sigHist->Integral(0,_sigHist->GetNbinsX());
00430           VetoFraction *loss = new VetoFraction(purity, lossFraction);
00431           lossCollection->addElement(loss);
00432 
00433         }
00434 
00435         if (referenceLossCollection)
00436           for (ThresholdMap_t::const_iterator iter = _referenceThresholds.begin(); iter != _referenceThresholds.end();++iter) {
00437             float purity = iter->first;
00438             float threshold = iter->second;
00439 
00440             Int_t thresholdBinSignal = _sigHist->FindBin(threshold);
00441             float lostEvents = _sigHist->Integral(thresholdBinSignal,_sigHist->GetNbinsX());
00442             float lossFraction = lostEvents/_sigHist->Integral(0,_sigHist->GetNbinsX());
00443             VetoFraction *loss = new VetoFraction(purity, lossFraction);
00444             referenceLossCollection->addElement(loss);
00445           }
00446 
00447 
00448 
00449         Double_t signalInt = _sigHist->Integral(1,_sigHist->GetNbinsX());
00450 
00451         // announce the result
00452         for (int i=0; i< thresholdCollection->getNumberOfElements(); ++i) {
00453           VetoThreshold *tr   = dynamic_cast<VetoThreshold*>( thresholdCollection->getElementAt(i));
00454           VetoFraction  *loss = dynamic_cast<VetoFraction*>( lossCollection->getElementAt(i));
00455           streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " Threshold for rejection of " << tr->getPurity() <<"% ("<<tr->getEffectivePurity() <<") of double particles: " << tr->getThreshold() << "+-" << tr->getThresholdError() << " loss in total statistics: " << loss->getFraction()*100 << "%"<< std::endl;
00456         }
00457         for (int i=0; i< referenceLossCollection->getNumberOfElements(); ++i) {
00458           VetoFraction *loss = dynamic_cast<VetoFraction*>(referenceLossCollection->getElementAt(i));
00459           float purity = loss->getPurity();
00460           streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " Loss for rejection of " << purity << "% of double particles with reference threshold " <<_referenceThresholds[purity] << ": " << loss->getFraction()*100 << "%"<< std::endl;
00461 
00462         }
00463 
00464         // now try to estimate number of double particles
00465 
00466         subHistBiasRemoved = (TH1*) subHist->Clone("subHistBiasRemoved");
00467         bias = new TF1("bias","pol1",pedestal+4*MIP,maxRange);
00468         subHist->Fit(bias,"RQ0N");
00469         bias->SetRange(minRange,maxRange);
00470         subHistBiasRemoved->Add(bias,-1);
00471         subHistBiasRemoved->GetXaxis()->SetRangeUser(dynamic_cast<VetoThreshold*>(thresholdCollection->getElementAt(0))->getThreshold(),maxRange);
00472         Double_t doubleParticles = subHistBiasRemoved->Integral();
00473 
00474         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " double particle events: " << doubleParticles << std::endl;
00475         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " estimated fraction of double particles: " << doubleParticles/signalInt << std::endl;
00476         now = std::time(NULL);
00477         streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "done " << std::asctime(std::localtime(&now));
00478 
00479 #ifdef MULTI_DBINIT
00480 #ifndef USE_CONDDB
00481 #error Cannot use -DMULTI_DBINIT without using -DUSE_CONDB
00482 #endif
00483         if (_thresholdFolderName != "" || _rejectedFractionFolderName != "" || _rejectedFractionReferenceFolderName != "")
00484           if (_startTime != 0 && _endTime != 0) {  // do not write Runs without events
00485 
00486             streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " writing threshold results to database fodler: " << _thresholdFolderName << std::endl;
00487             lcio::LCTime startTime(_startTime);
00488             lcio::LCTime endTime(_endTime);
00489             streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << " results are valid from  " << startTime.getDateString() << " to " <<endTime.getDateString() << std::endl;
00490             if (_thresholdFolderName != "") {
00491               lccd::DBInterface db( MULTI_DBINIT , _thresholdFolderName, true );
00492               db.storeCollection( _startTime, _endTime, thresholdCollection, "multi thresholds calculated by multiCalibrator-Processor" );
00493             }
00494             if (_rejectedFractionFolderName != "") {
00495               lccd::DBInterface db( MULTI_DBINIT , _rejectedFractionFolderName, true );
00496               db.storeCollection( _startTime, _endTime, lossCollection, "fraction off rejected beam events for a cetain purity threshold" );
00497             }
00498 
00499             if (_rejectedFractionReferenceFolderName != "") {
00500               lccd::DBInterface db( MULTI_DBINIT , _rejectedFractionReferenceFolderName, true );
00501               db.storeCollection( _startTime, _endTime, referenceLossCollection, "fraction off rejected beam events for a cetain purity threshold" );
00502             }
00503          }
00504 #endif
00505       }
00506       else {
00507         streamlog_out(ERROR) << "Signal or pedestal histogram is missing. Cannot calibrate" << std::endl;
00508       }
00509 
00510       std::ostringstream fileName;
00511 
00512       fileName << _outputFilePath << "Run" << _runNumber << "_multiCalib.root";
00513 
00514       streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "Writing multi histograms to " << fileName << std::endl;
00515 
00516       TFile *file = new TFile(fileName.str().c_str(),"RECREATE");
00517 
00518       if (_pedHist) _pedHist->Write();
00519       if (_sigHist) _sigHist->Write();
00520       if (pureMIPhist) pureMIPhist->Write();
00521       if (oneMIPhist) oneMIPhist->Write();
00522       if (twoMIPhist) twoMIPhist->Write();
00523       if (fitHist) fitHist->Write();
00524       if (fitResultHist) fitResultHist->Write();
00525       if (fitHistFine) fitHistFine->Write();
00526       if (subHist) subHist->Write();
00527       if (subHistBiasRemoved) subHistBiasRemoved->Write();
00528 
00529       if (convoluter) convoluter->Write();
00530       file->Write();
00531       file->Close();
00532 
00533       if (g) delete g;
00534       if (l) delete l;
00535       if (gg) delete gg;
00536       if (ll) delete ll;
00537       if (bias) delete bias;
00538 
00539       if (convoluter) {
00540         streamlog_out(MESSAGE)  << " convoluter deleted " << std::endl;
00541         delete convoluter;
00542       }
00543 
00544     }
00545   }
00546 
00547 
00548 }
